page.title: 02MORWELLHAM QUAY CENTRE
page.content:
{ { Morwellham}was a port in the 19th century for the copper mines of the Tamar Valley.When the mines closed it fell into ruins.In l970 it was opened as an open air Museum which has grown in size ever since. {Mr Emerson},the manager,told us that there were 3 purposes for the Centre.1)To preserve the port. 2)To raise money for this through visitors. 3)To recreate the port as it was in the 19th century.
There are about 130,000 visitors a year.On the busiest days there are about 1800. The Centre employs 130 people in the summer and 80 in the winter.It is the biggest employer in the area.
